description: Mozilla's Pocket read-it-later web bookmarking service will be discontinued in July. Users have a few months to export their data before permanent deletion. While some Pocket functionalities will remain accessible via Firefox, users dependent on the social bookmarking app can try these four alternatives as the service prepares to shut down in the coming weeks.
title: Mozilla's Pocket Bookmarking Service to Shut Down in July: Top Four Pocket Alternatives in 2025

description: X (formerly Twitter) is experiencing widespread outages, including in India, with users unable to load posts or videos on both the website and mobile apps this Saturday. Reports on a popular downtime tracking website confirm the inaccessibility. While the X developer platform indicated a site-wide outage was resolved days ago, some login-related functions are still suffering degraded performance.
title: X Down? Thousands of Users Report X Website and App Not Working

description: Manufacturing iPhones in India remains significantly more cost-effective than in the US, even with a potential 25 percent tariff, according to a report from the Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI). US President Donald Trump recently threatened to impose a 25 percent tariff on Apple if it increases production in India, but GTRI suggests India's economic viability for manufacturing persists despite these challenges.
title: Made in India iPhones Will Still Be Cheaper in the US, Even With Donald Trump's 25 Percent Tariff: GTRI Report

description: Xiaomi captured the top spot in the Q1 2025 wearable band market, boosted by refreshed Mi Band and Redmi Watch models earlier this year, according to a Canalys report. The company's shipments surged 44 percent YoY, as Apple dropped to second place, and Huawei, Samsung, and Garmin followed. A new study also highlights affordability, long battery life, and health tracking as key smartwatch features for consumers.
title: Xiaomi Surpasses Apple to Lead Wearables Market in Q1 2025 With 19 Percent Market Share: Canalys

description: Vivo X200 FE is expected to launch in India soon, and the handset has appeared on the BIS (India) and IMDA (Singapore) certification websites, in a sign that its global launch is imminent. The Vivo X200 FE is reportedly a rebranded Vivo S30 Pro Mini, which is already slated to debut on May 29 in China.
title: Vivo X200 FE Reportedly Listed on BIS, IMDA Certification Websites Ahead of Anticipated Launch in India

description: Realme GT 7 series is set for its global debut in the coming days, with all three models confirmed for India. Next week, the brand will unveil the Realme GT 7 and GT 7T, alongside a special GT 7 Dream Edition. With the Realme GT 7 series launch around the corner, Realme has already revealed key specifications and the designs of these highly anticipated smartphones.
title: Realme GT 7 Series: Global Launch Date, Expected Price in India, Specifications and Features

description: Oracle reportedly plans to spend approximately $40 billion on Nvidia's high-performance chips to power a new US data center for OpenAI. According to a report in The Financial Times, Oracle will acquire around 400,000 of Nvidia's powerful GB200 chips. Located in Abilene, Texas, this data center is part of the US Stargate Project, aimed at boosting the US' AI industry amid global competition.
title: Oracle Said to Buy $40 Billion of Nvidia Chips for OpenAI's US Data Center
